title: Putin Taps Central Bank Chief for Third Term With Mandate to Cushion Economy From Sanctions
sub_head: Elvira Nabiullina, Russiaâ€™s central bank chief, left rates unchanged but signaled the economy faces an inevitable period of higher inflation
body:
President Vladimir Putin nominated Bank of Russia Gov. Elvira Nabiullina, a longtime ally, for a third term as head of the bank, signaling that he wants continuity in economic leadership as the country absorbs the pain from its war with Ukraine and Western sanctions.
Russia faces a deep recession, major job losses and spiraling inflation. A weakened ruble is pushing prices of imports even higher, while sanctions will likely lead to shortages of many goods as job losses mount.
